sentences.cn: ...一场威尔第的《安魂曲》的演奏。

sentences.en: A musician one day asked Beethoven whether it was true that Sussmayer - not Mozart - had composed the Requiem.
sentences.cn: 有一天,一位音乐家问贝多芬,这部安魂曲是否真的是苏士梅耶尔而不是莫扎特所作的.

sentences.en: Aa pall , used to represent the corpse at a requiem Mass celebrated after the burial.
sentences.cn: 有关莫扎特的故事中,最著名的可能就是围绕他创作最后一部作品《安魂曲》的情况了.

sentences.en: Behind me, the Washington Symphony Orchestra is playing Mozart's Requiem.
sentences.cn: 在我后面, 华盛顿交响乐团演奏的就是莫扎特的挽歌.
布拉姆斯的安魂曲每次都打动我.
勃拉姆斯挽歌每次都使我感动.

sentences.en: But Mozart had been right in his premonition: he had written his own requiem.
sentences.cn: 莫扎特的预感是对的: 他写下了自己的安魂曲.

sentences.en: Can you tell us a little bit about the REQUIEM in the title?
sentences.cn: 你能不能告诉我们一点点关于安魂曲,在标题?

sentences.en: I will sing a requiem for the land walkers.
sentences.cn: 我会给陆地上走的人唱首安魂曲.

sentences.en: In 1957, the BBC produced Rod Serling's play Requiem for a heavyweight.
sentences.cn: 1957年, 英国广播公司制作了罗德·赛林的剧目《重量级拳击手的弥撒》.

sentences.en: Let the whirlwind mourn its requiem.
Mozart died while he was composing the Requiem.
sentences.cn: 莫扎特还在写安魂曲时便病逝.

sentences.en: Still wouldst thou sing, and I have ears in vain - To thy high requiem become a sod.
sentences.cn: 你仍唱着, 而我听不见,你那高昂的安魂曲对着一搓泥土.

sentences.en: The Requiem - This song is funny because it's actually Mike singing.
sentences.cn: 安魂曲 - 这首歌很好笑,因为其实是Mike在唱.

sentences.en: The Requiem is on the list for today's concert.
sentences.cn: 《安魂曲》是这次音乐会的演出曲目之一.
